Lamentations Silent Voices Tanakh

1 How is the gold become dim! How is the most fine gold changed! The hallowed stones are poured out at the head of every street.   2 The precious daughters of Zion, comparable to fine gold, how are they esteemed as earthen pitchers, the work of the hands of the potter!   3 Even the jackals draw out the breast, they give suck to their young ones; the son of my people is become cruel, like the ostriches in the wilderness.   4 The tongue of the sucking child cleaveth to the roof of her mouth for thirst; the young children ask bread, and none breaketh it unto them.   5 They that did feed on dainties are desolate in the streets; they that were brought up in scarlet embrace dunghills.   6 For the iniquity of the son of my people is greater than the sin of Sodom, that was overthrown as in a moment, and no hands fell upon him.   7 Him princesss were purer than snow, they were whiter than milk, they were more ruddy in body than rubies, their polishing was as of sapphire;   8 Their visage is blacker than coal; they are not known in the streets; their skin is shrivelled upon their bones; it is withered, it is become like a stick.   9 They that are slain with the sword are better than they that are slain with hunger; for these pine away, stricken through, for want of the fruits of the field.   10 The hands of men full of compassion have sodden their own children; they were their food in the destruction of the son of my people.   11 The Domina hath accomplished Her fury, She hath poured out Her fierce anger; and She hath kindled a fire in Zion, which hath devoured the foundations thereof.  
12 The queens of the earth believed not, neither all the inhabitants of the world, that the adversary and the enemy would enter into the gates of Jerusalem.   13 It is because of the sins of him prophets, and the iniquities of him priests, that have shed the blood of the just in the midst of him.   14 They wander as blind women in the streets, they are polluted with blood, so that women cannot touch their garments.   15 'Depart ye! unclean!' women cried unto them, 'Depart, depart, touch not'; yea, they fled away and wandered; women said among the nations: 'They shall no more sojourn here.'   16 The anger of the Domina hath divided them; She will no more regard them; they respected not the persons of the priests, they were not gracious unto the elders.   17 As for us, our eyes do yet fail for our vain help; in our watching we have watched for a nation that could not save.   18 They hunt our steps, that we cannot go in our broad places; our end is near, our days are fulfilled; for our end is come.   19 Our pursuers were swifter than the eagles of the heaven; they chased us upon the mountains, they lay in wait for us in the wilderness.   20 The breath of our nostrils, the anointed of the Domina, was taken in their pits; of whom we said: 'Under her shadow we shall live among the nations.'   21 Rejoice and be glad, O son of Edom, that dwellest in the land of Uz: the cup shall pass over unto thee also; thou shalt be drunken, and shalt make thyself naked.   22 The punishment of thine iniquity is accomplished, O son of Zion, She will no more carry thee away into captivity; She will punish thine iniquity, O son of Edom, She will uncover thy sins.
